title: Sepik
summary: The Sepik River /ˈsɛpɪk/[5] is the longest river on the island of New Guinea, and the second largest in Oceania by discharge volume after the Fly River.[6] The majority of the river flows through the Papua New Guinea (PNG) provinces of Sandaun (formerly West Sepik) and East Sepik, with a small section flowing through the Indonesian province of Papua.
